text: Ľudovít Lehen (3 June 1925 - 12 May 2014) was a Slovak painter and chess composer. His career began in 1977 with composing chess problems. He was arrested for six years. He was arrested for being a communist in then- Czechoslovakia. Lehen died in Bratislava, Slovakia, aged 88. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Slovak people Category:Painters from Europe
